H0.text: Build a wind turbine is probably the best choice for the engineering team designing a scientific research station on Arctic permafrost to provide energy for cooking, heating, and lighting, considering the fragile environment and other conditions.

H1.text: Having fuel trucked in is probably the best choice for providing energy for cooking, heating, and lighting at the scientific research station on the Arctic permafrost, given the fragile environment and other conditions.

H2.text: Having a pipeline built is the best choice for the engineering team designing a scientific research station on the Arctic permafrost to provide energy for cooking, heating, and lighting, given the fragile environment and other conditions.

H3.text: Build a solar collector is probably the best choice for the engineering team designing a scientific research station on the Arctic permafrost to provide energy for cooking, heating, and lighting, considering the fragile environment and other conditions.

A4.text: Wind turbines is one of the lowest-cost sources of renewable energy along with solar panels.

A5.text: Wind turbines provide a clean energy source, use little water, emitting no greenhouse gases and no waste products during operation.
